title: pasta
description: Classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water according to package instructions until al dente.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and black pepper.
In a skillet, cook diced pancetta until crispy. Remove from heat and drain excess fat.
Once spaghetti is cooked, drain and reserve some pasta water.
Add hot spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta. Toss to combine.
Pour egg and cheese mixture over the hot spaghetti. Quickly toss to coat the pasta, using reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce if needed.
Serve immediately with additional grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper.

title: rice
description: Fragrant and flavorful rice dish infused with aromatic spices.
instructions: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the minced garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and ground cinnamon to the pot. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the rinsed basmati rice to the pot and stir to coat the rice with the spices.
Pour in the chicken or vegetable broth and add salt to taste. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Simmer the rice for 15-20 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot as a delicious side dish.

title: bread
description: Freshly baked bread with a crispy crust and soft interior.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the warm water, sugar, and active dry yeast. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add the flour, salt, and olive oil to the yeast mixture. Stir until a dough forms.
Transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, or until the dough is smooth and elastic.
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Punch down the risen dough to release the air bubbles. Shape it into a loaf and place it on a greased baking sheet or in a greased loaf pan.
Cover the loaf with a clean kitchen towel and let it rise again for about 30 minutes.
Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the bread sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack before slicing and serving.

title: lasagna
description: Hearty and comforting lasagna layered with rich meat sauce, creamy béchamel, and melty cheese.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and garlic, cooking until soft.
Add ground beef to the skillet, breaking it apart with a spoon. Cook until no longer pink.
Stir in tomato sauce and Italian seasoning. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions; drain.
Spread a layer of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Layer with noodles, more sauce, spoonfuls of ricotta mixture, mozzarella, and Parmesan. Repeat layers.
Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and browned.
Let it cool for 15 minutes before serving.

title: brownie
description: Fudgy, chocolatey brownies with a crackly crust, perfect for any chocolate lover.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.
Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla.
Beat in cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Do not overcook; the brownies should be soft in the center.
Let them cool in the pan before slicing into squares.

title: tiramisu
description: Classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers, mascarpone cheese, and cocoa powder.
instructions: In a heatproof bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until well combined.
Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water (double boiler) and continue to whisk until the mixture is pale and thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the bowl from heat and allow the mixture to cool slightly.
Add the mascarpone cheese to the egg mixture and fold until smooth and well combined.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture until fully incorporated.
In a shallow dish, combine the brewed espresso and coffee liqueur (if using).
Quickly dip each ladyfinger into the espresso mixture, ensuring they are soaked but not soggy.
Arrange a layer of soaked ladyfingers at the bottom of a serving dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers, smoothing it out evenly.
Repeat the layers with the remaining soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture.
Cover the tiramisu with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.
Before serving, sift cocoa powder over the top of the tiramisu.
Slice and serve chilled. Enjoy!

title: Pizza
ingredients: 300 g TINE® Real Grated Cheese Original
instructions: Preheat the oven to 225°C.
Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Add oil and salt. Stir in flour until you get a smooth dough. Let the dough rise in a warm place for about 20 minutes.
Pizza Filling:

Brown the ground beef in butter over high heat. Add onion, garlic, tomatoes, tomato paste, salt, sugar, pepper, and water. Let the sauce simmer for about 10 minutes until it starts to thicken. Sprinkle with basil.
Roll out the dough thinly on a baking sheet and spread the meat sauce evenly over it. Sprinkle with grated cheese and red onion. Bake the pizza for about 25 minutes.

title: Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Dough:
Pour milk and egg into a mixing bowl and crumble in the yeast. Mix until the yeast is dissolved.
If using dry yeast, mix it directly into the flour.
Add sugar, wheat flour, cardamom, and salt. Knead for 10 minutes. If you knead the dough long enough, it will heat up enough that you don't need to heat the milk beforehand.
Add room temperature butter in cubes and knead until the dough releases from the bowl and you can stretch the dough without it breaking. This takes another 10-15 minutes.
Cover the dough with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise for about 45 minutes.
Filling:
Mix room temperature butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a separate bowl to make the filling.
Cinnamon Rolls:

Sprinkle some flour on the work surface and remove the dough from the mixing bowl. Quickly knead it with your hands. Then roll out the dough into a rectangle, about 30x50 cm. Spread the filling evenly over the entire surface.
Cut the dough into slices about 1 cm thick and place the slices close together in an ovenproof dish or baking sheet.
Cover the rolls with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel and let them rise for another 30 minutes.
Bake the rolls in the middle of the oven at 225 degrees Celsius for about 15-20 minutes until they are golden and airy. Baking time may vary with oven and roll size.

title: Cookies
description: A classic recipe for American cookies! Large, delicious soft cookies that are crispy on the edges and chewy in the middle. Really good chocolate chip cookies!
instructions: Instructions
Preheat the oven to 190°C. Beat room temperature butter, sugar, and raw cane sugar until white using a stand mixer or electric whisk.
Add one egg at a time, beating well between each egg. Add flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and vanilla sugar, and mix until well combined.
Coarsely chop the chocolate and fold it into the dough. Optionally, save some for decoration on top.
Place 1-2 tablespoons of dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Ensure there is plenty of space between each cookie as they spread out, about 6 per sheet.
Tips: To get evenly sized cookies, you can use an ice cream scoop to scoop up the dough and place it on the baking sheet.
Place some chocolate pieces on top of each cookie and bake in the oven for about 12-15 minutes or until golden. Cool slightly on the baking sheet before transferring to a rack.
